Action: # Premium Subscription: Premium Access
premium_subscription/premium_access
## Unauthenticated access
Setup: Use the publisher_csv_upload testdrive to setup for this test at /testdrive/premium
Setup: At the end of the test please use the 'teardown' link provided by the testdrive to remove test assets from the system, unless you are going to continue with the other tests in this suite
Access the system as an unauthenticated user (i.e. don't log in)

Go to the 'Journal CSV' page via the Data menu at the top of the home page

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com/docs/journal-csv

Expected Test Results: There is a page that offers you documentation and information about the Journal CSV

Action:
Click the "Journal CSV" link to download the CSV

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//csv

Expected Test Results: You are prompted to download a CSV file
The file is called "free.csv"

Action: Download the file

Expected Test Results: The file is successfully downloaded

Action:
Go to the "Public Data Dump" page via the Data menu at the top of the home page

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//docs/public-data-dump

Expected Test Results: There is a page that offers you documentation and information about the Public Data Dump
There is no way to access the Public Data Dump file from the page

Action:
Go to the journal OAI feed, using the provided link

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//oai?verb=ListRecords&metadataPrefix=oai_dc

Expected Test Results: Your are shown an XML document with a list of journal records
The most recent journal (the top one) has a `datestamp` field which is at least 30 days before today

Action:
Go to the article OAI feed, using the provided link

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//oai.article?verb=ListRecords&metadataPrefix=oai_dc

Expected Test Results: Your are shown an XML document with a list of article records
The most recent article (the top one) has a `datestamp` field which is at least 30 days before today

Action: ## Authenticated, free PDD access

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//csv

Expected Test Results: You are prompted to download a CSV file
The file is called "free.csv"

Action: Download the file

Expected Test Results: The file is successfully downloaded

Action:
Go to the "Public Data Dump" page via the Data menu at the top of the home page

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//docs/public-data-dump

Expected Test Results: There is a page that offers you documentation and information about the Public Data Dump
There is are links to download the Public Data Dump files
The "last updated" dates state they are around (slightly less than) 30 days old

Action:
Click the link to download the Article Public Data Dump file

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//public-data-dump/article

Expected Test Results: You are prompted to download a file
The file is called "article_free.tar.gz"

Action: Download the file

Expected Test Results: The file is successfully downloaded

Action:
Return to the "Public Data Dump" page

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//docs/public-data-dump
Click the link to download the Journal Public Data Dump file

Expected Test Results: You are prompted to download a file
The file is called "journal_free.tar.gz"

Action: Download the file

Expected Test Results: The file is successfully downloaded
